dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 6885 IH: Presidential Ballot Integrity Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Higgins of Louisiana (for himself, Mr. Weber of Texas, Mr. Burlison, Mr. Harris, Mr. Duncan, Mr. DesJarlais, Mr. Nehls, Mrs. Harshbarger, Mrs. Luna, and Mr. Ogles) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on House Administration

form.official-title: To amend title 3, United States Code, to include under the Electoral Count Act of 1887 that the vote of an elector of a State shall not be counted if, with respect to the election for President, the State did not include on the ballot in the State a candidate for President who was nominated by a major political party, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Presidential Ballot Integrity Act.

section.header: Rejection of electoral votes of a State in certain cases

subsection.text: Section 15(e)(1)(B) of title 3, United States Code, is amended by inserting if, with respect to the State of the elector in question, a candidate for President who was nominated by a major political party for election to such office did not appear on the ballot of the State or after shall not be counted.
Section 15 of title 3, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
For purposes of this section, the term major political party has the meaning given the term major party in section 9002 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
